Question: After retiring from the presidency in March 1797, this person returned to Mount Vernon with a profound sense of relief.
Hints: Along with their Mingo allies, this person and some of his militia unit then ambushed the French.
This person, already wealthy, declined the salary, since he valued his image as a selfless public servant.
On November 25, the British evacuated New York City, and this person and the governor took possession.
